column1: '''Wilfred Rowland Childe''' ([[1890]] - [[1952]]) was a British poet and critic. He was also a friend of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and godfather to his son [[Christopher Tolkien|Christopher]]. Like Tolkien
column2: he was a Roman Catholic (having converted in 1916).

column1: Childe was educated at [[wikipedia:Harrow School|Harrow School]] and [[wikipedia:Magdalen College
column4: he joined the English School at the [[University of Leeds]]
column5: and became a colleague of Tolkien.

column3: a publication to which also Tolkien contributed. And together with poetry by Tolkien
column4: Childe's work was published in ''[[A Northern Venture]]'' and ''[[Leeds University Verse 1914-24]]''.

column1: *[[Letter to George Allen and Unwin]] (letter from Tolkien concerning Childe)
